content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is an example function that creates a new column `ym` based on the year and month extracted from the `dt` column:
```julia
function add_yearmonth(df)
    df[!, :ym] = map((x) -> x.year * 100 + x.month, df[:dt])
end
```
This function uses the `map` function to apply a transformation to each element of the `dt` column in the DataFrame. The transformation is defined as `(x) -> x.year * 100 + x.month`, which extracts the year and month from the DateTime object and concatenates them together as an integer in format "yyyymm".

To use this function, you can call it with the DataFrame `df` as an argument:
```julia
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will create a new column `ym` in the DataFrame `df`, containing the year and month extracted from the `dt` column.
